org.openimaj.image.processing.resize

Class ResizeProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.resize.ResizeProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageProcessor<FImage>, Processor<FImage>, SinglebandImageProcessor<Float,FImage>

    @Reference(type=Incollection,
           author="Schumacher, Dale",
           title="Graphics Gems III",
           year="1992",
           pages={"8","","16"},
           chapter="General Filtered Image Rescaling",
           url="http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=130745.130747",
           editor="Kirk, David",
           publisher="Academic Press Professional, Inc.",
           customData={"isbn","0-12-409671-9","numpages","9","acmid","130747","address","San Diego, CA, USA"})
public class ResizeProcessor
extends Object
implements SinglebandImageProcessor<Float,FImage>
    Image processor and utility methods that can resize images.

    Based on filter_rcg.c by Dale Schumacher and Ray Gardener from Graphics Gems III, with improvements from TwelveMonkeys and ImageMagick, which in-particular fix normalisation problems.

    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FILTER

        public static final ResizeFilterFunction DEFAULT_FILTER
        The default TriangleFilter (bilinear-interpolation filter) used by instances of ResizeProcessor, unless otherwise specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(ResizeProcessor.Mode mode)
        Constructor that takes the resize mode. Use this function if you only want to double or halve the image size.
        Parameters:
        mode - The resize mode.

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(float amount,
               ResizeFilterFunction ff)
        Constructor a resize processor that will rescale the image by a given scale factor using the given filter function.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to scale the image by
        ff - The resize filter function to use.

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(float newX,
               float newY,
               ResizeFilterFunction ff)
        Construct a resize processor that will rescale the image to the given width and height with the given filter function. By default, this method will retain the image's aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new width of the image.
        newY - The new height of the image.
        ff - The filter function to use.

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(float amount)
        Constructor a resize processor that will rescale the image by a given scale factor using the default filter function.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to scale the image by

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(float newX,
               float newY)
        Construct a resize processor that will rescale the image to the given width and height with the default filter function. By default, this method will retain the image's aspect ratio which means that the resulting image may have dimensions less than those specified here.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new width of the image.
        newY - The new height of the image.

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(int maxSize)
        Construct a resize processor that will rescale images that are taller or wider than the given size such that their biggest side is equal to the given size. Images that have both sides smaller than the given size will be unchanged.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum allowable height or width

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(int maxSizeArea,
               boolean area)
        Construct a resize processor that will rescale images that are either bigger than a maximum area or are taller or wider than the given size such that their biggest side is equal to the given size. Images that have a smaller area or both sides smaller than the given size will be unchanged.
        Parameters:
        maxSizeArea - The maximum allowable area, or height or width
        area - If true, then the limit is the area; false means limit is longest side.

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(int newX,
               int newY,
               boolean aspectRatio)
        Construct a resize processor that will rescale the image to the given width and height (optionally maintaining aspect ratio) with the default filter function. If aspectRatio is false the image will be stretched to fit within the new width and height. If aspectRatio is set to true, the resulting images may have dimensions less than those specified here.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new width of the image.
        newY - The new height of the image.
        aspectRatio - Whether to maintain the aspect ratio or not

      • ResizeProcessor

        public ResizeProcessor(int newX,
               int newY,
               boolean aspectRatio,
               ResizeFilterFunction filterf)
        Construct a resize processor that will rescale the image to the given width and height (optionally maintaining aspect ratio) with the given filter function. If aspectRatio is false the image will be stretched to fit within the new width and height. If aspectRatio is set to true, the resulting images may have dimensions less than those specified here.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new width of the image.
        newY - The new height of the image.
        aspectRatio - Whether to maintain the aspect ratio or not
        filterf - The filter function

      • resizeMax

        public static FImage resizeMax(FImage image,
               int maxDim,
               ResizeFilterFunction filterf)
        Resize an image such that its biggest size is at most as big as the given size. Images whose sides are smaller than the given size are untouched.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to resize
        maxDim - the maximum allowable length for the longest side.
        filterf - The filter function
        Returns:
        the input image, appropriately resized.

      • resizeMaxArea

        public static FImage resizeMaxArea(FImage image,
                   int maxArea,
                   ResizeFilterFunction filterf)
        Resize an image such that its area size is at most as big as the given area. Images whose ares are smaller than the given area are untouched.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to resize
        maxArea - the maximum allowable area.
        filterf - The filter function
        Returns:
        the input image, appropriately resized.

      • resizeMax

        public static FImage resizeMax(FImage image,
               int maxDim)
        Resize an image such that its biggest size is at most as big as the given size. Images whose sides are smaller than the given size are untouched.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to resize
        maxDim - the maximum allowable length for the longest side.
        Returns:
        the input image, resized appropriately

        Parameters:

        maxArea - the maximum allowable area.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • halfSize

        public static FImage halfSize(FImage image)
        Halve the size of the image. Note that this method just samples every other pixel and will produce aliasing unless the image has been pre-filtered.
        Parameters:
        image - The image halve in size
        Returns:
        a copy the the image with half the size

      • internalHalfSize

        protected static void internalHalfSize(FImage image)

      • resample

        public static FImage resample(FImage in,
              int newX,
              int newY)
        Returns a new image that is a resampled version of the given image.
        Parameters:
        in - The source image
        newX - The new width of the image
        newY - The new height of the image
        Returns:
        A new FImage

      • resample

        public static FImage resample(FImage in,
              int newX,
              int newY,
              boolean aspect)
        Resamples the given image returning it as a reference. If aspect is true, the aspect ratio of the image will be retained, which means newX or newY could be smaller than given here. The dimensions of the new image will not be larger than newX or newY. Side-affects the given image.
        Parameters:
        in - The source image
        newX - The new width of the image
        newY - The new height of the image
        aspect - Whether to maintain the aspect ratio
        Returns:
        the input image, resized appropriately

      • resample

        public static FImage resample(FImage in,
              int newX,
              int newY,
              boolean aspect,
              ResizeFilterFunction filterf)
        Resamples the given image returning it as a reference. If aspect is true, the aspect ratio of the image will be retained, which means newX or newY could be smaller than given here. The dimensions of the new image will not be larger than newX or newY. Side-affects the given image.
        Parameters:
        in - The source image
        newX - The new width of the image
        newY - The new height of the image
        aspect - Whether to maintain the aspect ratio
        filterf - The filter function
        Returns:
        the input image, resized appropriately

        public static FImage zoom(FImage in,
          org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle inRect,
          FImage dst,

        Draws one portion of an image into another, resampling as necessary using the default filter function.
        Parameters:

        in - Source Image
        inRect - the location of pixels in the source image
        dstRect - the destination of pixels in the destination image
